metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5163 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The APN decode functionality in (1) epan/dissectors/packet-gtp.c and (2) epan/dissectors/packet-gsm_a_gm.c in the GTP and GSM Management dissectors in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.9 does not completely initialize a certain buffer, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark11 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs2 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil9 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
